title: Which cities in America are the most and least racist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Racism is pervasive in the United States. There is no part of the country that is unaffected. There is no good measure of racism, so there is no way to rank cities according to the racism of their people. An effect of racism that can be measured, though, is residential segregation. The Social Science Data Analysis Network has developed a measure of segregation called the dissimilarity index, which they have calculated for metropolitan areas, rather than cities. The metropolitan area with the greatest residential segregation is Gary, Indiana. This includes not only the (mostly black) city of Gary but also a number of (mostly white) suburbs in northern Indiana. The metropolitan area with the lowest residential segregation is Jacksonville, North Carolina, which is dominated by military facilities with little or no residential segregation. Looking only at metropolitan areas with more than 1 million residents, the most segregated is Detroit; the least segregated is Orange County, California. The least segregated with a really dominant core city is Las Vegas. Another answer here mentions Houston, but metropolitan Houston actually has a fairly high dissimilarity index, higher even than Boston, for example, despite Boston’s reputation for segregation.
